thread.title: Olympic leaders agree on independent drug-testing system
thread.title_full: Olympic leaders agree on independent drug-testing system

title: Olympic leaders agree on independent drug-testing system
text:
IOC decides to make drug-testing independent of sports bodies; asks WADA to take over THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   1:07 pmLast   1:07 pm   
Subjects: 
Switzerland (91) 

LAUSANNE, Switzerland â€” Olympic leaders have agreed to make drug-testing independent of sports organizations and are asking the World Anti-Doping Agency to take over responsibility for testing on a global level. 
Doping was a top item on the agenda Saturday when IOC President Thomas Bach convened an Olympic summit of international sports leaders in Lausanne. 
The IOC says in a statement that the group "decided to make anti-doping testing independent from sports organizations." 
It says the summit "requested WADA to study taking responsibility for testing as the global center of competence in anti-doping." 
The study will be carried out by a WADA working group that includes Olympic leaders and government representatives.
